text: The women's 4 × 100 metres relay competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place on 14 July at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was the United States team. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |42.10 |Karl-Marx-Stadt, East Germany |June 10, 1979 |- |Pan American Games record | |42.90 |Mexico City, Mexico |1975 |} ==Results== All times are in seconds. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font- size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Rank !Nation !Competitors !Time !Notes |- | | |Valerie Brisco, Karen Hawkins, Chandra Cheeseborough, Brenda Morehead |43.30 | |- | | |Leleith Hodges, Rosie Allwood, Carmetta Drummond, Merlene Ottey |44.18 | |- | | |Marta Zulueta, Silvia Chivás, Isabel Taylor, Eloína Echevarría |46.26 | |- |4 | |Maria Luísa Betioli, Sueli Machado, Olga Verissimo, Sheila de Oliveira |46.98 | |- |5 | |Divina Estrella, Marisela Peralta, Felicia Candelario, Tereza Almánzar |47.25 | |- | | |Margaret de Jesús, Madeline de Jesús, Georgina López, Nilsa París | | |} ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games 1979
